page.title: 03Industry in SW Hamilton
page.content: There is little industry in the block due to its largely rural character, although it once had several large mines. The main source of industrial jobs is the Cadzow Industrial Estate. This was the site of a large light-engineering plant (Maclean's Windows) which employed roughly 1500 people. Now it has several small, Hi-tech Firms instead. The area was once the site of Cadzow Colliery. The number of people employed was around 250. Other industrial concerns include 2 Garden Centres, a large Bus Company, and a Plant Hire Firm. These employ very few in comparison to older times.
